post.content:
Fortnite’s Champion Sequence (FNCS), the game’s pinnacle competitive sequence, will dole out a staggering $20m entire prize money in 2021.

Gamers will proceed to compete in a spoiled-platform pool with weekly qualifiers, then semi-finals and finals played out on separate weekends to put collectively participant fatigue.

The foremost three weekly qualifiers will exhaust space within the first three weeks of February, with semi-finals within the first week of March and finals the week after.

Official coverage will now be broadcast in a pair of languages for the first time, with French, German and Spanish audio system.

Gameplay adjustments within the most up-to-date season embody the removal of some traversal items to nerf circulation (Rift Fish and Shockwave Grenades) as effectively as the disabling of Elevators and IO Guards (AI enemies which is ready to rapidly spotlight your house and disrupt one-on-one performs).

FNCS will hasten with trio-primarily primarily primarily based groups but additionally embody Solo Saturday cups for cash prizes and various trio and limited-time mode (LTM) cash cups alongside.

Will at the moment time’s contemporary legendary Predator item that turns you invisible even be integrated, I marvel?
